item.title: Singtel has released its annual festive film about a lost phone just before Christmas
item.description:
Singtel’s latest holiday film centers around the importance of family connection during the Christmas season, particularly in Singapore’s tech-savvy environment. The film, titled The Gift, portrays a teenager excessively focused on her digital life and how this affects her family’s Christmas traditions. The creators were inspired by research indicating that people of all ages, across demographics, are spending a significant amount of time on their phones, even more so than quality time with their families...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/singtel-has-released-its-annual-festive-film-about-a-lost-phone-just-before-christmas/

item.title: Amazon has introduced exclusive holiday offers for Prime Now members
item.description:
This holiday season, Amazon Prime members in Singapore can enjoy thousands of deals on local and international products through the Prime Now app. These deals cover a wide range of categories, from toys and electronics to beauty products and holiday essentials. Since its launch, Prime Now has expanded its offerings to include new brands like Yakult, Dell, Tefal, Sambucol, Bausch & Lomb, and Pinkfong. New categories such as fresh flowers, organic fruits (including durians), and international foods have also been added...

item.title: Celebrate the end of the year with eco-friendly festivities at East, Hong Kong
item.description:
The environmentally conscious EAST, Hong Kong hotel is ready to celebrate the holiday season this year with special decorations and exciting events. Continuing a tradition that began in 2014, EAST’s Christmas Village highlights creative recycling. This year, the EAST team gathered fallen logs left behind by Typhoon Mangkhut from the city streets to create unique Christmas decorations. Students from Jockey Club Sarah Roe School (JCSRS), the only school in Hong Kong offering an English curriculum for students with additional learning needs, collaborated with the EAST team on this project...

item.description:
Source: House of Sillage. House of Sillage, a high-end perfume maker, introduces its Holiday fragrance for the Christmas season. The perfume features a blend of mandarin, peach, and vetiver, creating a festive aroma. The design of the fragrance bottle draws inspiration from the illuminated Rockefeller Center Christmas tree in New York City. Its snow globe cap, crafted from 18-karat gold and white gold, depicts a scene of falling snow. The floral and citrus perfume is housed in a hand-polished glass bottle with an ombre lacquer finish...

item.title: Experience the flavors of an Italian Christmas at Casa Ferrero in Singapore
item.description:
This year, Ferrero, the maker of Ferrero Rocher chocolates, has brought a touch of Italian Christmas magic to Singapore. Casa Ferrero, their only Southeast Asian pop-up shop, exudes elegance. The shop’s design echoes the gold of the classic Ferrero Rocher praline, enhanced by sparkling crystal chandeliers, the inviting aroma of espresso, and the distinct essence of roasted hazelnuts. Located outside the Wisma Atria mall along Orchard Road in Singapore, Casa Ferrero is even larger than last year’s pop-up, Pasticceria Ferrero...

item.title: Festive takeaways and buffets at Hotel Jen Tanglin
item.description:
Hotel Jen Tanglin’s popular “Fully-Loaded” holiday takeaway meal is back. This offering features a whole roasted turkey, accompanied by all the fixings, conveniently packaged in a thermal bag. It’s designed to easily serve 10 to 12 guests. According to Vathsala Subramaniam, General Manager of Hotel Jen Tanglin Singapore, they’ve crafted a special Asian roasted turkey using the “percik” style. This approach aims to blend tradition with a distinct Asian flavor. For those with bigger parties, ordering both the Western and Asian style turkeys ensures a diverse culinary experience for everyone...

item.title: Be cautious of malware with a Christmas theme
item.description:
Christmas tree, Marina Bay Sands. _"…On the twelfth day of Christmas my true love gave me: Twelve pieces of malware Eleven malfunctioning firewalls Ten ransomware dangers Nine account breaches Eight adware websites Seven deceitful emails Six compromised PDFs Five warning signs Four spyware-infected games Three junk text messages Two Trojan horses And a phishing email!"_ Holiday greetings can carry hidden cyber threats, even if sent from loved ones. Yeo Siang Tiong, Southeast Asia General Manager at Kaspersky Lab, emphasizes the importance of robust computer and mobile device protection before engaging in holiday activities like downloading festive content, sending emails, or online shopping...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/be-cautious-of-malware-with-a-christmas-theme/

item.title: Amazon is sharing the best-selling Christmas items from Prime Now Singapore orders
item.description:
Amazon has revealed the top-selling items purchased by Prime Now users in Singapore during a record-breaking holiday season worldwide. Customers took advantage of Prime Now’s “Ultra-Fast Delivery” option throughout the holiday period, with tens of thousands of products delivered, even in the final hours. The last Prime Now order was delivered at 10:23 p.m. on December 24th. “The volume of shoppers in Singapore using Prime Now leading up to Christmas was remarkable, as was the number who signed up for a free Prime trial or initiated a paid membership,” shared Kourosh Kaghazian, Country Manager for Amazon Singapore...

item.title: During the holiday season, Transamerica Life Bermuda and the World Wide Fund for Nature are advocating for the conservation of forests
item.description:

Transamerica Life Bermuda (TLB), a life insurance provider for high-net-worth individuals, has teamed up with the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) in Singapore to launch the Rewrap Project. The campaign, which will run until December 24, 2019, aims to raise awareness about the dangers of deforestation and the importance of forest conservation. All proceeds will support WWF’s conservation initiatives. In 2018 alone, Singapore generated about 1 million tonnes of paper waste...

item.description:
Stationery The Scenic Route 2021 calendar Victoria McGrane, an illustrator and textile designer, collaborated with Rainforest Rescue, an organization dedicated to rainforest protection and restoration since 1999, to create a 2021 calendar. McGrane, the talent behind The Scenic Route brand, is known for her hand-illustrated designs and stationery that showcase the beauty of Australian nature. Her work has garnered attention and partnerships with prominent brands. “Protecting and restoring Australia’s valuable rainforests is incredibly important to me, and I’m thrilled that my illustrations and travel inspiration can contribute to safeguarding these ancient forests and their wildlife,” shared McGrane...
